# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using Base.Threads: @threads

function pig_latinify(words::Vector{String})
    @threads for i in 1:length(words)
        word = words[i]
        if word[1] == 'a' || word[1] == 'e' || word[1] == 'i' || word[1] == 'o' || word[1] == 'u'
            # If the first letter is a vowel, add "yay" to the end
            words[i] = word * "way"
        else
            # If the first letter is not a vowel, move it to the end and add "hay"
            vowels_found = false
            new_word = ""
            for c in word
                if c == 'a' || c == 'e' || c == 'i' || c == 'o' || c == 'u' || c == 'y'
                    if !vowels_found
                        # If this is the first vowel, add "ay"
                        new_word *= "ay"
                        vowels_found = true
                    end
                    new_word *= c
                else
                    # Otherwise, just append the consonant to the end of the word
                    new_word *= c
                end
            end
            words[i] = new_word
        end
    end
    return words
end
```

This function uses `@threads` macro to parallelize the loop over each string in the vector. It checks if the first letter of the word is a vowel and applies the appropriate transformation for pig latin. If not, it moves the first consonant (or the entire word if there's no vowel) to the end and adds "ay" to form the pig latin version.
